quote: Station log, Stardate 47573.1.  We're    getting more and more requests for    information about setting up colonies    in sectors close to the wormhole.     So, Chief O'Brien and I have set out    to survey near-by star systems for M-   Class planets.
If it's an imposition...
Nossir, it'll be fine...
You're sure.
I'm sure, Commander.  Jake's a good    fella.  I'll enjoy working with him.
I don't want you to make it easy for    him, Chief.  He's got to know what    it takes to make it in Starfleet.
I'll have him up to his elbows in    thorium grease, sir.
It's not going to be easy for him.     He placed in the lower third of his    age group in mechanical aptitude...
Good for him.  So did I.
You.  Come on...
No, it's true.  It wasn't till I got    to the Cardassian front that I found    out I had talents I never knew I    had...
At the front?

It was a matter of figuring out how    to get a field transporter operational    in ten minutes or wind up a Cardassian    prisoner of war.  Now, I didn't know    a transporter from a turbolift in    those days... but somehow, in nine    minutes and fifty-three seconds, I    got that thing to work.  Got thirteen    men safely off the surface of Setlik    Three.  Next thing I know I'm tactical    officer on the Rutledge.  That's how    I got the gold suit.
Well, Jake's ready for a new suit    too.  The boy seems to grow a    centimeter a week...       He struck me out with a curve ball    the other day.  First time.
They grow up in a hurry, don't they,    sir...
That they do.
Hey, I think I found one... Computer,    set a new heading four-one mark three-   zero-one...
Confirmed.
It's M-Class all right.  One hundred    and sixty million kilometers from    Orellius Minor.  Should be a perfect    place to set up a colony...
Uh huh.  Only it looks like someone's    beat us to it.
You're reading life forms?
Human life forms.
I don't see anything on the books    about a colony in the Orellius    system...
Trying all hailing frequencies.
Moving into synchronous orbit.
No response.       I'm picking up some sort of low level    duonetic field down there... it might    be interfering with communications.
Computer, ready transporter.
Yours too?
Self-diagnostics aren't even working.     It's just plain dead.
Sisko to Rio Grande...       Computer, respond.
I'd say we have no E-M activity down    here at all...
Any idea why?
I'm not sure... it might have    something to do with the duonetic    field our sensors picked up.
Well, I hope you can find a few more    of those talents you never knew you    had, Chief.  Or we're gonna have a    hard time getting off this...
Don't move!
And put your hands up.
Turn around -- slowly.
They're from Starfleet!
That's right.  Mind if we lower our    hands?
The uniforms have changed --       -- or have I just forgotten what    they looked like?       My name is Joseph.  Vinod's the one    playing with the sharp object.
Benjamin Sisko.  This is Miles    O'Brien.
How'd you get here?
I was just going to ask you the same    question.
We were surveying for habitable    planets when our sensors picked up    your lifesigns... there was no record    of a human colony here...
Our group was on its way to settle    on Gemulon Five over ten years ago    when our ship developed life support    problems and we had to land for    repairs.
Once we got here, all our systems    failed, nothing worked anymore...
So we've seen...
We've been stuck here ever since.  I    guess you are too now...
We have a ship in orbit... it    shouldn't take our people long to    find us...
We'll be able to get all of you out    of here...
After ten years, this has become    home...
But you said it yourself -- nothing    works.
We still do.  Come on, we'll show    you.  Vinod, run ahead and tell your    mother we have guests.
Erewon-class personnel transport...
Commissioned the "Santa Maria."     Now, we just call it "the cabin."
After all this time... visitors!     Welcome to our community.  Are there    others?
Just an empty runabout in orbit.     Hopefully, it'll attract some    attention.
"Runabout."  Is that some kind of    new Starfleet vessel?
(realizing he wouldn't     know)   Yeah, they commissioned the first    ones two years ago... they're short-   range interstellar craft... about a    quarter the size of your... "cabin"    here...
(explaining his     interest)   I was the engineer aboard the Santa    Maria...
(encouraging the     bonding)   You and Miles will have a lot to    talk about, Joseph... I'm sure we'll    all have questions for our guests...
Who won the soccer matches this    year... is Golanga still playing?
He hurt his knee four years ago.     They replaced it with a bio-implant    but he wasn't the same after that.       Who was it that won last year    anyway... I never can remember...
What are women's fashions like back    home now?
Chief, you're the married one...
Keiko, my wife... she's been    replicating longer dresses lately...
Oh no, that means I'll have to alter    everything I own...
... but it might just be the Bajoran    styles she sees on Deep Space Nine...
Deep Space Nine?
I'm sure Ben and Miles will be happy    to tell you everything you want to    know.  There'll be plenty of time    for that later.
Actually, the first thing I'd like    to do is to try and get some kind of    response from the E-M systems...
We gave up any hope of that years    ago...
We noticed a low-level duonetic field    in this area before we transported    down...
The same thing appeared on our sensors    when we were landing.  Our engines    failed almost the instant we hit the    surface.
Without a functional tricorder, it

We do know that the marshes all around    us are filled with astatine    deposits... that's the only    explanation we have...    (beat, with pride, to     the others)   But we've done pretty well without    our tricorders and E-M converters    and comlinks... haven't we?

After all, the human body is a    powerful tool.  It can plow the fields    and harvest the crops... construct    walls for protection from the    wilderness, weave clothes we need to    stay warm.  In a way, we've    rediscovered what man is capable of    doing without technology.  It hasn't    been easy.  We've had some bitter    winters.  We've lost some friends.     But we're proud of what we've    accomplished here.
You have every right to be.
Are we all going to leave when the    others come to rescue them?
That's something each of us is going    to have to think about, isn't it...
Are you going to leave, Alixus?
Speaking for myself...    (pauses for dramatic     effect)   ... no, I'll never leave.  And I'll    never want to change what we have    here in our community.  It means too    much to me.

While you're with us, you're welcome    to everything our community has to    offer.  The only thing we ask is    that you contribute.  We all work    for our supper here.  You'll be    surprised how much sweeter it tastes    when you do.
We'll be happy to do our part.
Joseph, find them some bunks...
Two more strong, healthy men, Vinod.     That could mean a lot to this    community.
Do you know an Admiral Mitsuya...
Best poker player in the fleet.     Next to me.
Well, he's diverting the Crockett to    stop at DS Nine the day after tomorrow    to "talk about Cardassian foreign    policy"...
That's just an excuse to get Benjamin    in a game... Mitsuya cleaned him out    last year.  We better hail the Rio    Grande and get them moving back this    way...
I've worked on Benjamin's poker for    two lifetimes... he just can't learn    to bluff...
That's odd...
I know... you'd think a man like    Benjamin...
No.  The Rio Grande.  It's not    responding to our hails.
Come in, Chief.  I was just reading    one of the books written by our host.     Alixus is quite a prolific author...
Yeah, a bunch of these were left in    my room too... I haven't had a chance    to look at them... what does she    write about?
She has something to say on just    about... everything!
(smiles, leafing     through a book)   Yeah?
Economic analysis.  Political    commentaries.  Literary critiques.     She says she's spent her life    examining the human condition.
And what's her prognosis?
Not very good.  She says we've become    fat and lazy and dull.
My wife told me something along those    lines just last week.

"The common conceit that the human    species has evolved over the last    several centuries is ludicrous.     What gains we have made have come at    the cost of our own core identities.     Man has lost touch with his true    power."
Sounds like it took a crash landing    for her to find her paradise.
Have you found anything in their    ship that might help us restore    contact with the runabout?
There's nothing to find.  Waveguides,    panels, conduits, baffle plates --    you name it, it's gone.  The ship    looks like it's been through a Ferengi    junkyard.
What happened to it all?
We threw it away.
Since none of it worked, to us it    was merely useless junk taking up    space.  And...
... Alixus felt its presence was a    constant reminder of who you used to    be.
We all had to abandon our dependence    on technology.  Removing every trace    of it made the transition easier.
As an engineer, you must've had some    problems with that...

I was the last convert.  But as time    passed, I realized Alixus was right.     She was helping us discover a new    philosophy of life together.  Because    we needed one to survive.  And I'll    tell you -- every one of us is better    for it.  We're more committed to    each other.  We're truly a part of    each other's lives.  We've renewed    the sense of community that man left    behind centuries ago.
Joseph, Meg's fever is getting    worse...
Either of you have medical training?
Just the basics all Starfleet officers    get.
I can use all the help you can    offer...
The new herb doesn't seem to be    helping at all.
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: May I see?
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: There's an insect here that transmits    a disease we haven't been able to    cure.  We've lost three to it already.
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: Have you found anything in the forest    that's like the sleeger fungi?
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: We've searched everywhere for the    right fungus or root that would draw    out the infection.
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: If it keeps spreading, she'll be    dead before the rescue team finds    us...
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: The medical kit in the runabout could    probably take care of it in a second.
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: We've got to find a way to restore    the com link to the transporter...
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: That will only be a waste of time...
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: This duonetic field inhibits energy    flow... but a duonetic field is a    form of energy too... so, maybe    there's a way to modify our    communicators to run off the field    itself...
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: Do you really think you could...
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: No.       If you want to put your efforts to    good use, search the forest for    something else we might use...
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: This is medicine from the dark ages.     You can't expect to save her if...
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: (interrupting,     controlled)   Ben, may I see you outside, please.
scene: 15   INT. COLONY SHIP - MEDICAL FACILITY - CONTINUOUS

quote: Talk like that isn't constructive.
I'm talking about saving the life of    one of your followers.
You don't understand us yet.  No one    follows me.  They follow their own    hearts.
My heart tells me to try and get to    my ship.

I'm sure it does.  But if we'd had    that attitude for the last ten years,    we wouldn't have been doing what was    necessary to survive here.  To find    the plants and herbs and molds that    cure disease.  We've conquered    seventeen illnesses with the most    powerful resource man has.  His    ingenuity.
It's an interesting philosophy, and    while we're debating it, a woman is    dying.
I won't have you disrupting everything    this community has worked for, Ben.
I don't intend to stay any longer    than necessary.

That's another thing.  Let's not    bring up the Starfleet rescue party    again.  Until they come... if they    come... you'll have to do things our    way.    (a beat, one final     thought)   I'd strongly advise getting rid of    those uniforms... by midafternoon,    it gets hot in the fields.
The Rio Grande's been spotted.
Where...
The details are coming in from    Starfleet... "the Romulan vessel    Gasko reported seeing an abandoned    runabout... markings NCC seven-two-   four-five-two... "
That's our ship all right...
"... traveling at Warp Two through    sector four-zero-one... "
At warp, with no one on board?
Command wants to know if we can send    someone to investigate...
Signal them affirmative.
I already have.
Runabout Pad "C."
You have a talent for this, Ben.
My father was a chef.  He grew all    his own vegetables.  My brothers and    I were sent out to the garden every    day.

(eager to make the     philosophical     connection)   So, this is a way for you to get    back in touch with your core identity.    (Sisko chooses not to     acknowledge)   There's nothing like eating what    you've picked with your own hands,    is there...
That's true.
Most of the others had only eaten    replicated food before they got    here... the flavor of the foods we    prepare --  it was quite a surprise    to them...
... but not to you?
No, my mother wouldn't ever let me    eat replicated food.
Are you as good a chef as your father?
Not even close.
You're being modest.  We ought to    get you into the kitchen, Ben... you    could provide a real service to the    community... I'll talk to my mother    about it...
What?
I can't help thinking what my wife'd    say if she saw me doing this...
Why?
Because around my house, I'm known    as The Black Thumb.  I'm just one of    those people, you know?  The only    way I could get anything to grow was    to marry a botanist.
A botanist.  Really?
You should have seen the arboretum    she grew on the Enterprise.  That's    where I asked her to marry me.  She'd    love it here, that's for sure...
Maybe you'll bring her someday...
Trouble is she'd never want to    leave...
That's okay too.
Get him into the shade.
Here, Stephan, chew these.  They'll    help you regain your strength.
What did he do to deserve this?
He stole a candle.
One candle?
How long was he in there?
Since this morning.
In that hellbox?
Is this part of your philosophy of    life too?
You're a Starfleet Commander.  I'm    sure you've had to discipline members    of your crew...
Discipline is one thing.  Torture is    another.
The first thing this community    accepted was the need to establish    rules of conduct.  All of us,    including Stephan here, approved    this form of punishment as necessary    and fair.
How are you, Stephan?
I'll be all right.  I'm sorry Alixus    that I... let the community down...
The matter is closed.  Go inside.     Get some rest now.
Thank you, Alixus.

Stephan will never steal a candle    again.  And neither will anyone else    who saw him here today.       In time, you'll understand that this    is a simple, effective way to maintain    law and order in our community.
Sir, I get the distinct impression    that she expects us to be here for    a while...
If there's a way to adapt the energy    in the duonetic field to get us back    to the runabout, I want you to find    it, Chief.
Aye, sir.
Is there anything you need?
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: No, I don't think so.
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I'm sorry... Alixus doesn't believe    in doors... we all take it for granted    now... you'll get used to it...
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Hopefully, I won't be here long enough    to get used to it...
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: You don't like it here, do you...
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: It's not what I'm used to.
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Alixus has reminded us all that it    wasn't easy for us at first either.     She's told us to be patient with    you.
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I know your muscles must be sore    from all the work today... this is    an oil extract from the Xupta tree.     It's wonderfully soothing.
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Thank you... I'll try some.
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Would you like me to give you a    massage with it?
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I... don't think so.  Thanks anyway.
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: It'll make you feel a lot better.
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Here let me show you...
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Did she send you here?
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Did she send you here to make love    to me...
scene: 23   INT. COLONY SHIP - SISKO'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Ben... come in, I was just writing    about you and Miles in my journal...    I understand you're quite a chef...
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Now, that's the first Core Behavior    I've seen from you since you    arrived...
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Core Behavior.  Does that chapter    come before or after "sexual    procurement?"
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I have a lot to say about sexuality,    Ben.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I have a feeling it might shock    someone as repressed as you seem.  I    assume you're talking about    Cassandra...
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Did you send her to my room?
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Yes.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I think you're contemptible.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Interesting.  Contemptible.       Try to see it through our eyes, Ben.     Just for a moment.  Cassandra came    to me... worried because she sensed    you weren't happy.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: She's right about that.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: She's concerned that all you see    here is work and hardship.  She wanted    you to share in our joy as well.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: So you sent her to win my devotion    to your cause...
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I suggested she could make it easier    for you to become a member of the    community... the choice was hers.       Cassandra really likes you, Ben.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: It's fortunate all these books of    yours weren't on PADDS like all the    other reading materials the colonists    brought.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I used to print them myself.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I'm not surprised.  And Vinod told    me you never ate replicated food    before you came here...
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I'm not sure I see the connection...
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Just that you never had much use for    technology, did you.  It's interesting    you happened to crash on a planet    that fit your... philosophy of life...    so well.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: I agree.  In fact, I've started    writing a book about our experiences.     I've been wondering if in the ancient    religions of man, there aren't some    new truths to be found... something    to explain how "fate" sometimes    delivers us exactly where we need to    be.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Perhaps one day you'll even feel the    hand of God on your shoulder.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: You are wonderful.  You won't give a    millimeter, will you.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Look at you.  Still wearing your    uniform.  Wanting so badly to get    back to your station with its    artificial gravity and its sterilized    air.  You are so disconnected from    your core identity, Ben.       There is a better way.  How can we    help you to see it.  Perhaps good,    hard work is the answer.       Vinod...
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: Ben will be standing watch tonight.
scene: 24   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - NIGHT

quote: You all right, Commander... ?
Just a little tired... I'll be fine...    any luck at your end?
This duonetic field is still a    mystery, sir... I can't believe it's    being generated by the astatine    deposits in the stream beds...

Good morning, Ben... ready for    breakfast... there's some lovely    fruit here... try this...    (offering a piece to     Sisko, he takes it)   We found it growing along the    riverbank a few years ago... some    kind of native pear... good isn't    it?
Oh, will you be able to work your    normal shift in the fields today?
What are you talking about... you    just had him up all night standing    watch...
Of course, if you'd like to be    relieved of your duties today, all    you have to do is ask.
I'll work my shift.

Good.  We're so shorthanded out there.     But you really should do yourself a    favor and change into more comfortable    clothes...    (starts to leave,     pauses)   Oh, by the way, you'll be pleased to    know that Meg seems better this    morning.  Joseph is very optimistic    about a new combination of herbs    he's tried.
We're picking up a ship ahead.  It's    the Rio Grande -- moving at warp one-   point-three.
Plotting an intercept course.  Once    we're abeam, match our speeds exactly    and I'll transport over.
Like hell you will.
Sorry, I'm the ranking officer...

At warp, I wouldn't be in such a    hurry to volunteer.       If Chief O'Brien were here, maybe...    without him, either one of us would    wind up a subspace particle field    off the Rio Grande's stern...
Got a better idea... ?
(standing and moving     to a rear panel)   I'm a science officer.  It's my job    to have a better idea.
What are you doing?
Trying an old rope trick I learned    on Earth once.
A rope trick.

A very talented Hopi I knew did things    with rope you wouldn't believe...    it's an old West American artform...    she could throw a lasso around Curzon    on the dead run from ten meters    away...
You're suggesting we try to "rope"    the Rio Grande at warp...
With a tractor beam.
When we pull it back to impulse,    isn't there a risk that the strain    will rip both hulls apart?
"I suppose?"
I suppose... there's a risk.
You're a science officer.  It's your    job to know if there's a risk.

Okay.  There's a risk.  If the ship    assembly teams back at the yards did    their jobs really well, we'll probably    make it.  If they had an off day,    we're gonna have a problem.  But    it's our best shot.  Unless, as    ranking officer, you have a better    idea...
We're within tractor range.  Locking    on.
Engaging impulse engines.
Remind me to send a thank you note    to the assembly teams.
All stop.    (as they rise and     move to the     transporter)   Computer, ready transporter...
I'm sorry... Alixus has just put    water rationing into effect for    today... no one is to get more than    one cup...
We do...
Why is she doing this...
Because we've failed you, Ben...    we've failed to help you and Miles    find your place here in the    community...
Meg has died.

It happened suddenly, quietly.  Her    suffering has ended.       No one was prouder of what we've    accomplished here than Meg was.  I    can remember during some of our most    difficult days... hearing her    distinctive laugh echo across the    field... and it would make me smile    and give me hope.  I wish I could    hear that laugh now.       Her dedication to this community, to    us was an inspiration.  Which is why    I find myself so troubled today by    an act that by its very nature defiles    her memory.       Vinod...

All of us have welcomed our new    arrivals with open arms... but they    continue to reject us.  Despite their    agreement to respect our fundamental    way of life, this man has committed    the worst offense that can be    committed against this community.     He has selfishly wasted precious    time that could have been put to    productive use.  Miles was discovered    attempting to activate his    technological devices... so he could    return to his ship...
Alixus, I'm sure he only wanted to    get to the medical equipment that    might have saved Meg's life...

Thank you, Joseph.  I knew you would    feel that way and I'm glad you said    it.  So all of us could see the true    danger these two represent.  Our own    Joseph defending what he knows is    wrong.  He knows if we had spent our    energy all these years trying to    escape, we would all be dead today.       This is good.  This is a test of our    convictions.  And we will survive.     To honor Meg and the others who have    died to create this community.  To    honor the living who believe in this    community.  We will survive.
I know your prejudice prevents you    from seeing us as we are.  In time,    you will understand.  And perhaps    even embrace us.
You're not putting him in there.
No, Ben,  I'm not.  You're his    commanding officer.  I hold you    responsible for his actions.  I'm    putting you in there.
(checking console     readings, curious)   No sign of resistance.  None of the    onboard weapons have been fired...
But their logs have been erased.     Someone else must have been here...
Maybe Sisko and O'Brien beamed off    before the ship was boarded...       But then why would someone send the    Runabout off at warp... why wouldn't    they keep it or destroy it...
I think they were trying to destroy    it.
How can you tell...

The hull's been exposed to high    temperatures and intense gamma    radiation...       ... if we retrace the Rio Grande's    course... it takes us right back    to...    (reaction as she gets     the results, looks     at Kira who sees     them too)
An F-type star...
Orellius Minor.  There's only one    way this ship could be coming straight    from Orellius Minor... and that's if    someone had tried to destroy the    ship by flying it into the star.
... and missed!

If the trajectory had been slightly    off, the star's gravity flux would    have deflected it in a new direction.     Computer, run a tractor beam to the    Orinoco and prepare for warp tow...       With a little luck, we'll be able to    find the warp signature the engines    left when they were fired up...
Tractor beam in place.
Course laid in for the Orellius
This is painful for me, too.  I want    so much to give you water... let you    lie down... sleep.  But I can't.     Not without your help.
scene: 38   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - DAY

quote: I know it's too difficult to speak    right now.  Just rest.
scene: 38   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - DAY

quote: Change doesn't come easily to you; I    realize that.  Believe me, I'm not    expecting a sudden, miraculous    conversion.  The change'll come by    itself... if you're open to it.
scene: 38   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - DAY

quote: But you do have to show us that you    are open to it.
scene: 38   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - DAY

quote: A good start would be to get rid of    that uniform.
scene: 38   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - DAY

quote: I'll leave you these clothes...
scene: 38   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - DAY

quote: Once you've changed, you can have    this cup of water.  And when you    drink, everyone will be allowed to    drink...
scene: 38   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - DAY

quote: Join us, Ben.
scene: 38   INT. COLONY SHIP - ALIXUS'S CUBICLE - DAY

quote: What are you doing here, Miles...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: I... need a little help, Joseph...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: With what?
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: There's nothing I can do.  Please    don't ask me...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: I've got to try and track down where    this duonetic field is coming from...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: We told you... there are astetine    deposits...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: That's not what's causing it... if    it were, I'd've had that transmitter    working and we'd all be out of here    already... it's something else...    and I've figured out a way that might    get me to the source of it...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: You want me to look the other way    while you leave...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: She'd put you in the box, wouldn't    she...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: Then, do me a favor and just look    down at this hematite deposit I just    found...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: Miles...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: I can do it so it won't hurt at all...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: I owe you one my friend...
scene: 48   EXT. JOSEPH'S WORK STATION - CLOSE ON HANDS

quote: Well, you finally got one of us out    of our uniform.
Get her out here!
Get him some water.
Do you know why this phaser works    now?
Because I shut down the duonetic    field that was keeping it from    working.  The artificially created    duonetic field.
Untie him, please.  He's not to blame.
The young man just fired a couple of    arrows at me.  In my community, that's    a crime.
Sisko to Rio Grande.  Computer    acknowledge.
Your ship is no longer in orbit,    Ben.  I destroyed it.
I assume that means -- you control    the duonetic field.

I helped to invent it.       You'd be surprised how many scientists    are sympathetic to my philosophies.     I met a quantum physicist at the    Delta Six station who was    investigating how certain radiation    inhibits electromagnetic flow.  I    immediately saw the potential of his    work.
Then... it was no accident that we    developed life support problems near    this planet...

No.  We were always on our way here,    Joseph.  I chose it months in    advance... it was far away from any    trade routes... completely isolated.     It was perfect for our ideal    community.  I hoped when we landed    here that we would never leave.
You lied to us.  You've been lying    to us for ten years.
Yes.  But perhaps a lie can lead to    a more important truth.  Would any    of you have learned who you really    are at the core if you hadn't come    here?

Joseph, you would have been a     repairman all your life.  Cassandra,    you would have been a technical clerk    in some closed-in room.  Stephan, my    friend, you would probably be in    prison by now.  Look at yourselves.     Look at what you've become.  What    you have achieved here has redefined    your potential... the potential of    man.  Just as I knew it would.  You    are the living proof.
And what of the dead.
What of Meg and the others?
Only my son knows how I suffered as    I watched each of them die.
You were willing to let them die to    prove your theories.  You're going    to have to answer for what you've    done.
I'm prepared to go with you.       Casualties were inevitable.  I had    to accept that from the start.
A philosophy of life was worth more    to you than life itself.
If it had been your son who was sick,    would you have let him die... ?
Yes.       For the sake of the community.  I    did it all for the community.
Kira to Sisko.  Are you all right,    Commander...
Everything's under control, Major.     Stand by to begin multiple transports.
Acknowledged.
We've got room for all of you on the    runabout... if you have anything you    need to bring with you, you ought to    go get it now...

This is our home, Miles.  Whatever    Alixus may be guilty of... she did    give us our community.  I'm not sure    if we'll leave the device on or off    now that we know it's there... and    we'll have to decide if we want to    establish contact with the outside    world.  But Alixus is right.  We    have found something here... that    none of us is willing to give up.
It's time for those of us who don't    belong here to leave, Ben.
Four to beam up, Major.
